availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Frances Asberry Myers on January 7, 1823. Father of Braxton Myers, Lucy Myers, and Harriett Myers. Married to Mary Myers. Father of George F. Myers, Martha Myers, Winfield S. Myers, Margaret E. Myers, and Lewis S. Myers. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1860. Employed Edward Porter as a laborer in Pendleton County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, District 2, p. 330B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, p. 573.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Pendleton County Marriages, 1799-1948, Film #000272800, p. 124, p. 450 of 660 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
